title: SB 1.15.50-51 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami |  06-01-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare, Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: These two verses are the last verses of this chapter. This chapter was entitled The Pandavas Retired Timely
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verses to be discussed, focusing on the Pandavas' retirement and preparation to return to Godhead.

segments.key_quote: Both she and Subhadra became absorbed in thoughts of Krishna and attained the same results as their husbands
segments.summary: The speaker explains the meaning of verse 50, highlighting Draupadi and Subhadra's devotion to Krishna and their attainment of liberation.

segments.key_quote: When flying an airplane one cannot take care of other planes. Everyone has to take care of his own plane
segments.summary: The speaker uses the analogy of flying an airplane to illustrate the importance of individual spiritual preparation before death.

segments.key_quote: For all that help is available, we must take help. The bona fide spiritual master, the scriptures, the instructions of the previous Acharyas, Guru Sadhu Shastra, and the association of devotees and our own practice, everything is required to be done
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of seeking guidance from spiritual masters, scriptures, and devotees, and engaging in personal practice.

segments.key_quote: It's not that at the time of death I'll start practicing, I'll start preparing. No. At the time of death if you are not ready to go back to Godhead, we have to accept another body
segments.summary: The speaker stresses the need for consistent spiritual practice throughout life, not just at the time of death, to avoid rebirth.

segments.key_quote: Similarly at the end of life, when one has to go back home, back to Godhead, everyone has to take care of himself without help rendered by another
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the roles of spiritual masters, parents, and relatives in providing guidance and support during one's lifetime.

segments.key_quote: Don't accept the position of becoming a father or a mother or a husband or a teacher or a devata or a king if you cannot deliver your dependents from the cycle of birth and death
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the responsibilities of superiors (spiritual master, parents, etc.) to train and guide their dependents towards spiritual liberation.

segments.key_quote: But while crossing the sea, one has to take care of himself and utilize the instructions formally received while actually going back to Godhead
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of individual effort and utilizing previously received instructions at the time of death, using Draupadi as an example.

segments.key_quote: While in this material existence the relationships are between the bodies, it is not between the souls... the soul however has eternal spiritual relationship with Krishna
segments.summary: The speaker differentiates between temporary material relationships and the eternal spiritual relationship of the soul with Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Draupadi's relationship with her five husbands was as long as the bodies were there... Draupadi had to take care of herself without waiting for her great husbands
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates the temporary nature of material relationships and highlights Draupadi's self-reliance in her spiritual practice.

segments.key_quote: One simply has to concentrate one's attention upon the lotus feet of Krishna completely on the lotus feet of Krishna, one straight goes back to God
segments.summary: The speaker explains that focusing one's attention on Krishna's lotus feet at the time of death leads to immediate liberation.

segments.key_quote: The wives also got the same result as their husbands in the same manner... so there is no discrimination women men wife husband
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that there is no discrimination in the process of bhakti, and both men and women can achieve liberation.

segments.key_quote: Especially in Kali Yuga everyone should chant Hare Krishna and then simply by chanting Hare Krishna even at the time of death if you are engaged in chanting Hare Krishna or hearing the holy name or remembering the holy name you straight are transferred to the kingdom of Kali Yuga
segments.summary: The speaker encourages everyone to chant Hare Krishna, especially in Kali Yuga, as it leads to liberation, and mentions that the wives' bodies became spiritualized through devotional service.

segments.key_quote: Anyone who hears this narration with devotional faith certainly gains the devotional service of the Lord, the highest perfection of life
segments.summary: The speaker introduces verse 51, emphasizing the auspiciousness of hearing the narration of the Pandavas' departure and the benefits of doing so with devotional faith.

segments.key_quote: One who hears this narration with devotional faith, this is the highest perfection to get devotion for the lotus feet of Krishna and thereby simply by that devotion one gets transferred to the spiritual kingdom of God Krishna at the end of life
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by reiterating the benefits of hearing Bhagavatam with devotional faith, leading to devotion to Krishna and transfer to the spiritual kingdom at the end of life.
